intro: Cordula venusta, commonly known as the beautiful cordula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Cordula venusta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
